bio.short: I'm a creative technologist who believes great work happens when human creativity and AI-enabled tools work in tandem.
bio.full: I'm a creative technologist who believes great work happens when human creativity and AI-enabled tools work in tandem. With a background in web development, creative direction, design, and marketing, I help Indeed's in-house agency build smarter creative workflows‚Äîfrom growth marketing and video production to illustration and social media. I think about the creative process holistically: where do humans make the irreplaceable decisions? Where can technology amplify what we do best? That's the sweet spot I'm always looking for. And it's always shifting. As new technologies emerge, that balance evolves, and staying effective means adapting alongside it.
bio.professional: Experienced creative director focusing on translating complex technical concepts into compelling and accessible experiences across physical and digital spaces for global technology companies such as IBM, HP, and Indeed. Proven track record of building and leading cross-functional teams within large organizations and bringing cohesiveness to technology brands.

design.title: IBM Watson
design.tagline: An enduring identity for artificial intelligence
design.description: Creating the original avatar for IBM's Jeopardy! Juggernaut
design.summary: The visual identity for IBM Watson, the groundbreaking natural language processing computer, was a pioneering effort that broke away from the fictional portrayals of AI often seen in popular culture. As the lead art director, I spearheaded a team that developed a unique blend of design and code, resulting in a visually striking identity that continues to inspire interactive experiences. The project was the culmination of a year of embedded research with the IBM team and collaboration with renowned visual artist Joshua Davis. The final product was prominently featured on the game show Jeopardy, where Watson famously competed against human champions, as well as in television commercials, an extended documentary, and print ads around the world, captivating global audiences. Over a decade later, the Watson identity remains an integral part of IBM's brand, a testament to its lasting impact and enduring relevance.

design.title: Rising Voices Tribeca
design.summary: Installation concept and creative direction for the premiere of Rising Voices Season 1, Tribeca Film Festival. A pyramid, skeletal and loose, built of director's chairs. All bone white, save for one defiant splash of blue at the peak, straining upwards. Like those bicycle sculptures of Ai Weiwei, but this, a rebellion of underrepresented voices. A lone chair, bright and poised, rising above the rest.

design.title: Indeed Job Market
design.tagline: Reimagining the job fair for the modern age
design.summary: As a creative consultant and designer, I worked closely with the marketing team at Indeed to reinvent the traditional job fair and launch the Indeed Job Market. This series of eight unique events across the United States aimed to provide job seekers with a more engaging and memorable experience. I led the design and creation of a wide range of materials for the event spaces, bringing the overall vision to life and ensuring a memorable experience for attendees nationwide.

design.title: Careers in Care by Indeed
design.tagline: Healthcare workers need help, not hype
design.summary: As the healthcare industry grappled with the aftermath of the pandemic, Indeed recognized the urgency to address the challenges faced by its workforce: widespread burnout, dissatisfaction, and mass resignations. In response to these challenges, we launched Careers in Care, a comprehensive initiative designed to support healthcare professionals at every stage of their career. I led a team of designers, writers, photographers, and videographers to create a campaign that showed healthcare workers as people, not heroes.

design.title: Work Sounds by Indeed
design.summary: Collaborating closely with my team and producers at You Had Me at Black, I played a key role in the development of Work Sounds, an original album designed to enhance the workday. I helped shape the album's narrative, which combines workplace recordings with melodic instrumentals. Leading the visual component of the project, I conceptualized, produced, and edited videos for YouTube and TikTok.

design.title: Work Wellbeing Series
design.tagline: Illustrating the modern philosophy of happiness at work
design.summary: Collaborating with Indeed's design team, I helped develop the Work Wellbeing Series, a project inspired by Indeed's three-year study on how people feel at work ‚Äî the largest of its kind. I conceptualized and created motion graphics based on research insights to illustrate workplace happiness.

design.title: Indeed on Youtube
design.tagline: Making the job search more accessible one Youtube video at a time
design.summary: As the creative lead, I was part of a collaborative effort to modernize and grow Indeed's YouTube presence. I worked closely with a cross functional team to carefully select the right agency partner that could bring our vision to life. Together, we developed four engaging video series, each with its own distinct creative direction.

design.title: Lowe's Fix in Six
design.summary: As an art director, I was part of the team tasked with expanding the groundbreaking success of the Lowe's "Fix in Six" campaign. Our challenge was to elevate the concept, crafting a second 'season' of videos that were more intricate and unforgettable than the first batch ‚Äì all within the six-second Vine format. Collaborating with a talented group of animators, puppeteers, and stop-motion directors, we transformed everyday home improvement hacks into captivating miniature worlds.

design.title: Mobil 1 Motorsports
design.tagline: When a second matters, science matters
design.summary: As art director for Mobil 1's motorsports campaign, I brought scientific sophistication to the world of high-performance racing. Leading both NASCAR and Formula 1 initiatives, I developed a visual narrative that transformed complex engineering into compelling storytelling.

design.title: HP: The Power of Touch
design.summary: As Art Director for HP's global consumer PC and laptop campaigns, I developed a creative concept centered on the power of human touch, showcasing the brand's innovative touchscreen technology through emotional storytelling. The campaign featured two distinct yet complementary approaches: a television commercial following Robbie Wilde, a deaf DJ who experiences music through touch, and a minimalist print campaign featuring ethereal, floating hands emerging from white space to engage with HP's touchscreen devices.

design.title: IBM Smarter Planet Series
design.tagline: What will it take to build a smarter planet?
design.summary: I led art direction for IBM's Smarter Planet Expert Series, creating interviews that brought IBM's experts and their ideas to light. By designing a focused on-set environment, I enabled direct conversations about security, healthcare, energy, and IoT while maintaining the campaign's visual identity.

design.title: IBM Smarter Planet
design.tagline: A global vision for a smarter planet
design.summary: I worked closely with the great team at Office to bring their Paul Rand-inspired smart icon illustrations to life in a global out of home campaign that helped launch IBM's Smarter Planet initiative. The campaign was displayed on various platforms, from simple bus shelters to entire building facades.
